snippet: Dewey & LeBoeuf’s slow disintegration shatters the long-held perception that law is a guild and a brotherhood — more profession than business.
abstract: James B Stewart Common Sense column argues that the disintegration of august law firm Dewey & Leboeuf lays bare the harsh reality that contemporary law practice is a business rather than a profession.
lead_paragraph: Dewey & LeBoeuf’s slow disintegration shatters the long-held perception that law is a guild and a brotherhood — more profession than business.

headline.print_headline: Dewey’s Fall Underscores Law Firms’ New Reality
headline.seo: Dewey’s Collapse Underscores a New Reality for Law Firms - Common Sense
headline.main: Dewey’s Fall Underscores Law Firms’ New Reality
